Steps to bring down a server for maintenance

  1. Verify you have an approved change control if the system is running a production application
  2. Verify you have an active blackout for the server affected. If not, enter one.
    1. Check to very if we have an active blackout
    2. Use this URL to enter a new one
  3. Get on to the console. Login to pgnmsv01
    getconsole <servername>
  4. Get a list of running processes
    ps -ef > /root/psef.$(date +%m%d%y)
  5. Get a list of mounted filesystems
    df -k > /root/mountedfs.$(date +%m%d%y)
  6. Get a list of disks and vgs pagingspace etc
    lsvg > /root/lsvg.$(date +%m%d%y)
lspv > /root/lspv.$(date +%m%d%y)
lsps -a > /root/lsps.$(date +%m%d%y)
  7. Check the bootlist against the last booted device
    bootlist -o -m normal > /root/bootlist.$(date +%m%d%y)
bootinfo -b > /root/bootinfob.$(date +%m%d%y)
  8. Shutdown the server
    shutdown -F
